{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3475658,"name":"","username":"Programming5130","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/4da419/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-08T19:42:26.511Z","cooked":"

Hello I am a programmer for team 5130 we are currently trying to program our Rev Swerve Drive and were having a problem with rotation, our wheels don’t line up and straight and when we try to drive we just end up spinning and slowly moving in a random direction. We program in Java and are using the Pigeon 2. I just took the example code from rev for the swerve drive and simply replaced the gyro in their code with the pigeon. I think part of the problem might have to do with the commands from the pigeon since methods like getRate and getAngle it tells us to replace it with Statussingal methods like getAngularVelocityZWorld which does not work with rotation2d or the “*” method of multiplying used at the end of the DriveSubsysem file. I am not a very experienced programmer so any help would be amazing thank you!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-08T19:42:26.511Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":781,"reads":177,"readers_count":176,"score":3935.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":480205,"topic_slug":"2025-frc-rev-swerve-drive-w-pigeon-2-programming-problems","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57662,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/2025-frc-rev-swerve-drive-w-pigeon-2-programming-problems/480205/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3475674,"name":"Owen","username":"Owen4026","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen4026/{size}/211145_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-08T19:51:30.430Z","cooked":"

I’m not very familiar with REV’s example code but it sounds like you might have an incorrect offset for each wheel. You need to measure the angles of each wheel when they are all lined up in one direction and add that to your code.

It would also be very helpful to share a link to your code.

Yeah, it looks like there are offsets in your Constants.java file lines 42-46. The values in there right now look like temporary placeholder values, you probably just need to measure the actual values and update them.

These constants are correct for the maxswerve code template. The maxswerve code adjusts the module angle to its location this way the swerve can be zeroed with the same zeroing jig no matter what corner it goes on the robot.

You need to use rev hardware client to set the swerve zero offsets in the swerve section of the app.
